title: Lead Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy. Had multiple interviews, and received offer at the end. My only complaint about the process was the low-ball offer. Rady's does not care about your education level in terms of negotiating.
Interview Questions: What kind of role do you play on a team?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter sent me an email advising me that the interviews were going to take place on a certain day. She asked me about my availability that day, so I took the day off of work so I would have the day wide open. I waited and waited to hear back from her about my interview time. As the day of interviews approached, I contacted her and she told me the interviews had been delayed by administration. I took the day off work for this interview and the recruiter couldn't even let me know they had been cancelled.
Interview Questions: We are scheduling interviews for this date, what time are you available?

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is phone and second one is a panel interview, the phone interview is just getting a general understanding of your work and background, the panel one could be intimidating but as long as you answer the questions to the best of your knowledge you'll be good.
Interview Questions: Ability to work in a stressful environment, knowledge of MFPs, desktop printers, small form factor printers, tablets, laptops and desktops. Ability to troubleshoot networking issues.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Casual and efficient. The call for interview was much later than expected but it still came. Interviewed by 3 managers. Have not heard back about position but hoping for the best.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with a coworker.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Tougher than expected interview! They asked a priority question that I was not prepared for so make sure you are critically thinking during the interview. It also seemed like they asked the same question in four different ways which tripped me up.
Interview Questions: What are some of the EBP projects you completed in nursing school

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have my interview in a few days and I want to prepare very well to this position. Because I think this company is professional and I they offered a good benefits.
Interview Questions: I don't know what questions they are going to ask me.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: They will email or call you to introduce and ask for an interview time that works for you. The interview will be about an hour. Then you’ll hear back from HR if you got the job or not
Interview Questions: Tell us about your strengths and why would you be a good candidate for Rady Childrens?

title: Supply Chain operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Spoke with 3 employees 
Pretty friendly interview, all smiles.
The questions weren't in a hostile or too strict of a manner they simply want to get to know you and see what your goals are.
Interview Questions: Are you fully vaccinated and boosted?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral style interview with patient scenarios and examples from your career to answer. Many questions multi-part. Very relaxed. Not sure what else to say about it. That’s all I have!
Interview Questions: Do t remember specifics. Patient scenarios.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Took a clinical test then interview with HR, was sent to second interview at the supervisor site. It was an average meeting but you must pass a test before the clinical portion as well. This was a few years back
Interview Questions: What makes you different from other candidates

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Great interview.  Very easy.  Not intimidating.  Made you feel at ease.  Not too many hard questions.  Did not ask too many personal questions.  Kept it professional the whole session.  Overall good interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you have done in your past experience?

title: RN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview and introduction including prior experience. Discussion of strengths and weaknesses and from there about 6-7 questions regarding personal experience and hypothetical questions regarding patient safety or high risk emergent situations
Interview Questions: What would you change or ask for if you could within your past departments?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process started with phone screening with a senior manager, later -  an on site interview with two team members. Interview process started with phone screening with a senior manager, later -  an on site interview with two team members.
Interview Questions: Questions about team work situations.

title: Developmental Services Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was a general phone screener where I was set up for the first interview. For the first interview, it was the manager and a couple people on the team. For the second interview, it was a larger portion of the team and the manager. At the end, they requested recs from my contacts, and then I was given an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself and why you chose to apply

title: Health Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy. I got a call about the job and set up the interview in the same day. The interview was quick and the next steps were sent to me right away.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Conducted two rounds of interviews with the last round as a series of back interviews spread across two days. 
 It included the hiring manager, the individual leadership at the SVP level, and leadership and colleagues in Marketing, Business Dev, and Finance.
Interview Questions: Share experience synthesizing information and data into powerpoint

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: During the interview process at Rady Children's Hospital, show up professionally dressed and prepare questions for interview. Also ensure you have questions to ask yourself. Do not ask about salary as they are union and that is predetermined unless you're critical care
Interview Questions: They questioned Strengths/Weaknesses with exmaples

title: Child and Family Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (Escondido, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was gentle. The people who interviewed me were friendly and easy going. The interview was quick and the questions were average. The interview was about 30 minutes and any questions at the end.
Interview Questions: How would I handle case files?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Typical research associate interview. Nothing too hard but they definitely look for you to prove why you want, deserve and are qualified for the job. Asking questions is key to succeeding at these interviews.
Interview Questions: What is the thing you are most proud of in your career so far?

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: On site interview. There was only one guy in the office that day. Also it was pretty late in the afternoon. Basic questions - self introduction, introduce your project, how you learn about this position..
Interview Questions: What is the definition of scientific method.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by four people. Each took turns asking me questions on a sheet of paper. The overall vibe was kind of awkward and the panelists didn't seem very interested in me from the beginning. One even look annoyed.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress, professionally and personally?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position and received a call pretty quickly after. Overall positive experience.  The interview was with the department director and an external staff member that they work closely with. The interview questions were pretty straight forward and it took about an hour and a half to complete the interview. The director called back the week after to say I did not get the job (which I appreciated so I wasn't left wondering) and even took time to provide feedback.
Interview Questions: What is a success/challenge that you've faced in previous programs? For challenges, how did you overcome them?

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
It can take a ridiculous amount of time for the entire hiring process. 
The same set of behavioral interview questions are standard and used for any hospital position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when...

title: PAR III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was given different scenarios and asked how I would handle them. Was asked where I see myself in 5 years. Given 3 tasks and asked in which order I would take care of them.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a panel after tour of unit.  less than enthusiastic staff. parking situation was interesting. new facility was nice but old hospital seemed run down and parking lot was.
Interview Questions: Why Rady?

title: Claims Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Went through a temp agency.  Went to the interview. Interviewed with leadership. Took a skills test. Interview lasted 30min. The agency handled the paperwork, drug test, background check, start date, badge photo and payroll checks.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a co-worker who was always negative

title: Ophthalmic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the Ophthalmology Office Manager to come in for a formal interview. Then after the first interview I was interviewed again by the Head Ophthalmologist.
Interview Questions:
It was more like a skills exam:
How many years of experience do you have in Ophthalmology?
 What is your knowledge working with children?
There were were scenario based questions:
What would a typical day be like in a clinical setting from previous employer?
How would you handle a difficult coworker/patient/parent?
When can you start?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about two weeks after I applied. I scheduled the interview for that same week. I was interviewed by two department supervisors. Interview lasted about 30 minutes. I was made an offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Rady Childrens?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They called me in, there were two females.  Immediately I could feel that they did not like me and proceeded a condescending interview.  There body language suggested that they were not accepting my answers.
Interview Questions:
Usual, like how to defuse the situation.
What was a difficult issue you were in and how did you turn it around

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for this position because the recruiter reached out to me and said I would be a good fit due to my leadership skills.
I did a few tests on the computer and then went into an interview with HR.  The lady who runs the interview is very serious and didn't make me feel comfortable. Unfortunately, I didn't get another interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled an irate client?

title: Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward--I applied and not too long after I was called for an interview.  Had an in person interview with three panelists that included the manager and two dietitians.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your future in dietetics?

title: Developmental Services Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly phone interview followed by in-person interview with two people. It was made clear during the phone interview that there's almost no room for salary negotiation. Questions were mostly behavioral based for the in-person interview. Received an email a month later stating that I didn't move on.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a goal you reached and how you achieved it.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. Pre- assessment test basic math and scenario based questions ( not too complicated)
2.One on one with HR/Microsoft and Outlook test/typing test, behavioral questions
3.Meeting with site supervisor to interview
This process takes a while but is well worth it! All the people I have met are super helpful and nice.
Interview Questions: What is teamwork?

title: Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the positon about two weeks ago before I received a call from Rady. I got an initial phone interview and talked about my job history with little IT questions. I later accepted a panel interview that consisted of 6 people: IT Manager, 3 techs, 1 lead, and a desktop technician.
Interview Questions: How well I managed stressed.

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First interview  was a test with trick questions, they try to confused  you so you really have to pay attention  to detail and check your work. No calculator where aloud, I got a call back the next day , so I'm interviewing in a day.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: During the initial interview asked basic HR competencies related to the job. Lengthy list of behavioral based questions and asked to provide examples. Interview was done in a group format. Contact was done by departmental team and not HR. Was invited back for a second interview which didn't take place, was provided a tour and given an electronic excel test. Contacted the team back to thank them numerous times via e-mail and absolutely no response back from the departmental team or HR. No contact was very disappointing. Particularly after contact by the departmental team that was up to four contacts per day by phone and e-mail. Was pursued for several weeks and at one point even asked for references.
Interview Questions: What interested you in applying for the position? How did you prepare for the interview?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviews conducted primarily via internet and video conference. 2 phone interviews and one video conference with entire research team. After video conference, received a call and email from Rady Children's recruiter, and later from HR. Required scheduled visit with Occupational Health to do physical health screen and drug test. Start date was about one week following Occupational Health appointment
Interview Questions: Can you pass a drug screen?

title: Administrative Associate B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied for several positions relating to Administrative jobs with minimum requirement to have an Associates degree. I have a bachelor's in Business Administration above an AA with experience. No email or any follow up to let you know of the job status. You need to check the website to read the computer generated notes whether or not your application has been considered to move on to the next step. Applying to Rady children's is a waste of time, unless you know someone or work with a staffing agency that specialize in helping you getting into healthcare administration.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Rady Children's?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, there is the MA assessment that consists of 15-20 questions with a "why did you become a medical assistant" question at the end. It's fairly easy if you know you dosage calculations and how to prepare an injection. Pass that assessment then move on to phase two, a computer test then a typing test. Pass those, then have an interview with HR. Pass that, then have another interview at the work site you'll be wanting to work. After that... I don't know. I'm still in the process.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? What qualities make a good team. Define teamwork. Talk about a time where you had a disagreement with a co-worker.

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process it’s variable you have to go through 2-3 interviews.
First boa phone
Second with supervisor in area
Third all mayor staff in the area interest=
Doctors, supervisor, lead RN and staff in position as yours.
Interview Questions: Why would you be best fit for this position you’ve applied for?

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: got lost in the cracks waited long time, I was offered the job and forgot about after doing all the required stuff needed to do, finally got the job after months and months. They said that to many people working the cases
Interview Questions: where do I find my self in 5 years, I had no idea where I wanted to be just with a company that was growing

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was called about 2 weeks after my application was submitted, Interview was great, standard questions along with behavioral style-teamwork-conflict resolution oriented. I was told I would be notified in 2-3 weeks either way (with or without a job offer), and was never contacted. I contacted the floor supervisor, the nurse recruiter twice, and finally sent a message to ask for feedback about what I might improve on. The lack of communication was very frustrating, but mostly because I had been led to believe I would be contacted. The Interview, was with a director, supervisor and nurse educators, they were all fantastic. I believe a change was transpiring that caused hiccups in the process.
Interview Questions: Name a time one of your Boundaries had been violated?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the application, I received an email from the manager about a month later. We scheduled a phone interview. A week later, I was invited for an interview and invited back for the computer skills testing. The process was efficient and moved along quickly which I liked.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you deal with a difficult co-worker or patient. How did you deal with it?

title: I Applied for A Surgical Technologist Position Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a group interview with lead staff members from the operating room, where each member of the panel asked two questions each. After they had finished, i was then allowed to ask any questions that I had. It was a great process and allowed me to determine whether it was a great fit for me as well as the organization.
Interview Questions: Please give a description of an abdominal appendectomy

title: Clinical Informaticist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was very thorough and inlcuded time with the entire team and clinical leadership. The process was well organized and they worked to find a time most convenient for me. The best part was talking with the team and getting their first hand accounting of how things are for them. The entire process was positive and productive.
Interview Questions: I like that they asked me what I like to do for fun.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was interviewed by HR.   Then I was interviewed by department supervisor.  Then I was interviewed by department director.  Three separate interviews on different days.   My interviews were friendly and focused on sussing out past experiences that would be helpful to the new position.  They were relaxed but professional (which I really liked).   The whole process took about a month from submission to hire date.
Interview Questions: How would you approach enlisting the cooperation of co-workers who are neither your direct reports nor in the same division/department as you?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got the call for the interview 3 months after I applied, the male that called me to set up the interview was rude over the phone, I already felt he was annoyed, plus he wasn't thorough with the location of the interview. The day of the interview I met with 2 people (same male that called me and one female). I arrived 10 minutes early waiting in the lobby and they were 20 minutes late to the interview. The male interviewer was very rude, he gave unpleasant facial expressions and kept looking at his watch as I answered their questions. I felt that I did not get to talk enough hence 30 seconds into me answering their questions he would sigh and interrupt me while I was talking. I felt like ending the interview and walking out. The interview was about 45 minutes, towards the end he said he would give me a tour of the clinic and he pointed at the recycle bin and said "That's where we recycle", walked me to the exit door, as we walked he said "this is the hallway". Terrible!
Interview Questions: How do you deal with diverse populations?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The 1st day was the test day, it was basic maths and 2 short answers about customer services situations. The next day, they called me to notice that I passed the test and made appointment for the 1:1 interview with human resource staff. No offer after this interview
Interview Questions: First questions was "do you have any questions for me?"

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Open interview hosted at the management services facility. Filled out an assessment         (basic math skills and short answer). Passed, got a call for a second interview which was a 1 on 1 with the Hiring Manager and completed a typing/Microsoft applications skills test. Passed, got called for a third interview with a panel consisting of three managers from three different campuses. sadly, no offer.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in working for Rady Children's Hospital?
Describe a time when you didn't get along with a co-worker?
If your Supervisor asked you to complete a task that you were not allowed to what would you do?
If you were asked to complete a list of tasks for your supervisor but were running out of time in the work day what would you do?
What are you strengths and weaknesses?
Tell me about yourself....

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview. I was invited to participate in a group interview two weeks later. There were 4 managers in the group interview and the questions were behavioral.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when you were challenged with a project? what was it, how did you handle it and what were the results?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview Rady uses is based on a series of questions posed to the interviewee, something like: describe a situation in which you had to mediate between colleagues; describe a time when you had to implement a difficult process, etc. The actual answers were important, but equally important was how the interviewee handled themselves. Did they ask clarifying questions when necessary? Did they make sure to answer the question asked?
Interview Questions: There was no question that surprised me or was particularly difficult

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had to take an IQ test on medical terminology, medication administration, a typing test, background check, drug test. After initial interview they would contact a specific site interested in me, then I had to go to another interview at that specific site and interview with the site supervisor
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: PC Customer Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Wow, what a doozy.  First, the hiring manager gave me the salary range in our first email communications before any interview.  I liked this because it was very straight forward and didn't waste time.  I was invited for an interview but did not expect a panel of ~8 people!  There was even someone on a speakerphone.  So intimidating right off the bat.  

The very first question came from the manager, "So, why Rady's?"  I can't stand this pretentious question but most of the big companies ask it.  It's so condescending like, "We are so great here and please tell us some Godly things about our organization."  I really just wanted to answer, “Because I’m looking for a job with better pay….”  However I didn’t and we moved forward.

Next, one of the 5 tech’s gave me a scenario question: “Phone rings at 4:55 pm and it’s a doctor in an operating room.  He wants you to help him with a piece of equipment that no one has ever seen before (including you).  As you get up to leave the CEO calls and has a powerpoint he is having trouble with and he is leaving for the airport in 15 minutes.  What do you do?”

My answer: “Tell the CEO I’ll be there in 10 minutes and go to the operating room.”

They were silent.  The tech looked at his manager and she leaned towards me and said, “Are you sure?  The CEO makes us money.”

I couldn’t believe it, they would rather go to the CEO then an operating room WITH A CHILD on the table.  I knew right then and there I could never work for such a deceitful company.  And by reading a lot of the negative reviews, I made the right decision.
Interview Questions: “Phone rings at 4:55 pm and it’s a doctor in an operating room.  He wants you to help him with a piece of equipment that no one has ever seen before (including you).  As you get up to leave the CEO calls and has a powerpoint he is having trouble with and he is leaving for the airport in 15 minutes.  What do you do?”

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (Murrieta, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with Unit Manager and Satellite Manager at site. They asked me a series of predetermined questions. After questions were asked, they used a point system to determine where I fell within their scale. I scored high marks and eventually was offered the job.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a angry parent?

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The online application is thorough and allows you to setup a job search client. For some positions, there will be additional questions to filter out unqualified candidates. [] I wasn't contacted for a couple of weeks after my application was submitted. I went through one phone interview and one in person interview. Some departments hold a succession of interviews, or group interviews where you might meet the entire department. [] The interview itself wasn't difficult, but it was long. Lots of story telling because it was a behavioral based interview. [] After accepting the position, it took another two weeks to go through their physical testing, drug test, etc.
Interview Questions: The questions were mostly behavioral based (e.g., how would you handle X, tell me about a time you X).

title: Financial Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online and received a call from HR a couple weeks later.  Round one was a one on one with the hiring manager.  None of the dreaded behavioral based questions.  Most of the questions were certainly geared towards the job function and company. "What is your experience using systems X, Y, Z?" "Why do you want to work at Rady?" The interview was a two way process and my questions were encouraged.  I was invited back for round two the next week.  This consisted of 4-5 one on one sessions with other people that work closely with the position.  These were of similar nature - two-way and casual but to the point.  Very friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about some difficult situations where working with an individual was difficult.

title: Credentialing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with all managers as well as those who would be my peers. It was fairly uncomfortable, they weren't friendly and seemed like they all wanted to be somewhere else.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: so long ago I can't remember except that the interviewer was very personable and relaxed.  There were  not a lot of questions related to scenarios or 'what would you do" type questions back then
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 telephone interviews as I lived in another state and for my final interview, I was asked to come to interview for the position in-person. I communicated with teh team via telephone and email contacts.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions, I used my experiences to answer the questions,a nd used apparent negative experiences into positive ones and described how I used the experiences to grow and change into a better person.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the supervisor of the PICU where there were mostly questions regarding one's personality versus actual clinical questions. The interview took approximately 30 minutes to 45 minutes. I was offered the position within a few days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had a conflict between a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Business Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rady Children's Hospital (San Diego, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Intense.  Approx. 200 pages of material.  One could get a CIA clearance after this hiring process.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.  The interview was mostly written out for the manager.
